item.title: External lectures
item.description:
Sometimes we go back to school and talk about Big Data including big data processing and monitoring.

Usually I cover these topics:

  • Big data processing in big organization
  • Monitoring solutions
  • Functional programming with R
  • Tidyverse approach
  • Web applications with shiny
  • Building REST API with R

Target audience - Data Science students in Vilnius University and Kaunas University of Technology.

item.title: Racing cars controlled by mind power
item.description:
This time R served as a backend for user registration, controlling car parameters and front end page. The plumber package made the development really easy (that’s what plumbers do).

Our booth was one of the most popular during the whole conference.

item.title: Augmented reality pool table
item.description:
Can you draw a pool table and make some real-time dashboards? “Sure I can.”

The whole project was a huge team effort! However, the interesting part for me was creating real-time visualizations from a data stream. I can tell you a secret - it’s the reactivePoll function in shiny server. How to draw a table, some balls and a path? The ggplot2 comes to the rescue with just a few lines of code.

Dbplyr package helped to summarise statistics and DT for table visualization - just in a few lines of code as well.

item.title: Lithuania's Strongest Man
item.description:
During my strongman times I manage to qualify into Lithuania’s Strongest Man Finals twice. Some of the personal records I managed to do during that journey are listed below:

  • 150kg log press
  • 160kg farmers walk each hand
  • 300kg axle deadlift
  • 140kg stone lift
  • Car deadlift

And lots of deadlift variations in various competitions:

item.title: Master Thesis
item.description:
It was a great honor to receive an award from Vytautas Janilionis in the National Prof. Jonas Matulionis mathematics competition back in 2007. Who could have thought that after a decade I will have this person as a supervisor for my Master’s Project in Data Science and I will do the last presentation in the auditorium named under J. Matulionis name. Being the first test rabbits in Vilnius group turned out just fine!

My Master’s Thesis was about customer review classification in e-commerce sector. I have used deep learning approach in combination with conventional NLP methods and implemented web service for real-time customer review classification.

item.title: Strength Clash 2018
item.description:
In this project I helped to organize an unusual strength competition for the 5th birthday of Urban Gym. Events were following:

Qualification (timecap 5min)

  • 15x Squat 120kg/50kg (men/women)
  • Row 500 m.

Quarterfinals (timecap 5 min)

  • 10x Pullup 24kg/bodyweight
  • 20x Dumbell Ground to overhead 40kg/15kg

Semifinals

  • Farmers walk 10 meters. Biggest weight wins

Final

  • Deadlift for reps (90 seconds) 200kg/100kg

item.title: VU powerlifting competitions
item.description: After I graduated from Vilnius University, I have continued to train at the best gym in Vilnius (VU Sport Center). Most of the people were interested in weightligting and kettlebell training. However, powerlifting became more and more popular within the community. Since I was training for IPF classics and it was cancelled due to unknown reasons, I decided to make our own competition in Vilnius University instead. We had a great team, find some sponsors and the idea became true.

item.title: MovieNations Rave On!
item.description:
During my gaming times I was featured in Counter-Strike movie for MovieNations contest.

The movie went viral back in the days and had nearly 200k views (not including re-uploads).

Big thanks to Pavelas ‘kab’ L. for making me a part of this!
